summary: 1991  was a common year starting on Tuesday of the Gregorian calendar.
full_text:
A Thousand Acres is a 1991 novel by American author Jane Smiley. It won the 1992 Pulitzer Prize for Fiction, the National Book Critics Circle Award for fiction in 1991 and was adapted to a 1997 film of the same name.
The novel is a modernized retelling of Shakespeare's King Lear and is set on a thousand acre  farm in Iowa that is owned by a family of a father and his three daughters. It is told through the point of view of the oldest daughter, Ginny.
title: A Thousand Acres
